Description: Rim sherd of Chian black-figured Sphinx and Lion Style pottery stemmed bowl; white slip; interior: reserved; exterior: around rim, short vertical strokes followed by narrow brown band; below, black-figure decoration consisting of lion (only back, tail, rump with added red blob and part of hindlegs remaining), to left; pendant rosettes with red centres as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College Dublin, Department of Classics, Classical Museum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Obtained by UCD from the British Museum. Lemos places this sherd in Group A of the Sphinx and Lion Style. The decoration on the vases from this group is the most elaborate. The rosette has a standard cogwheel shape, the figures are carefully drawn and details are expertly incised. Lions are usually depicted facing right, this lion is one of a few exceptions.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 146, p. 311, no. 1301, pl. 168)
Vickers 1971 / Some Unpublished Sherds from Naukratis in Dublin (p. 115, no. 3, pl. 13.C)
Johnston 1973 / A Catalogue of Greek Vases in Public Collections in Ireland (p. 430, no. 943)
CVA UCD & UCC / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Ireland, Fascicule 1: University College Dublin, University College Cork (p. 13, no. 3, pl. 11, no. 3)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2099) (phase 2)
